thread.title: Lester gives up big HRs, Cubs fall to Mets in NLCS opener
thread.title_full: Lester gives up big HRs, Cubs fall to Mets in NLCS opener

author: RONALD BLUM
title: Lester gives up big HRs, Cubs fall to Mets in NLCS opener
text:
David Goldman Lester gives up big HRs, Cubs fall to Mets in NLCS opener 
Chicago Cubs pitcher Jon Lester walks to the dugout after being taken out of the game during the seventh inning of Game 1 of the National League baseball championship series against the New York Mets Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/David Goldman) David Goldman Lester gives up big HRs, Cubs fall to Mets in NLCS opener 
Chicago Cubs pitcher Jon Lester walks back to the mound after walking New York Mets' David Wright during the fourth inning of Game 1 of the National League baseball championship series Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/David Goldman) Julie Jacobson Lester gives up big HRs, Cubs fall to Mets in NLCS opener 
Chicago Cubs pitcher Jon Lester reacts after getting New York Mets' David Wright to strike out during the fifth inning of Game 1 of the National League baseball championship series Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Julie Jacobson) Julie Jacobson Lester gives up big HRs, Cubs fall to Mets in NLCS opener 
Chicago Cubs pitcher Jon Lester reacts as he walks off the field during the sixth inning of Game 1 of the National League baseball championship series against the New York Mets Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Julie Jacobson) Frank Franklin II Lester gives up big HRs, Cubs fall to Mets in NLCS opener 
Chicago Cubs' Anthony Rizzo is hit in the hand as he slides safely back to first in front of New York Mets' Lucas Duda on a pick off attempt during the seventh inning of Game 1 of the National League baseball championship series Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Frank Franklin II) David J. Phillip Lester gives up big HRs, Cubs fall to Mets in NLCS opener 
Chicago Cubs' Anthony Rizzo reacts after getting hit on the hand on a pick off throw at first during the seventh inning of Game 1 of the National League baseball championship series against the New York Mets Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/David J. Phillip) Julie Jacobson Lester gives up big HRs, Cubs fall to Mets in NLCS opener 
Chicago Cubs' Kyle Schwarber rounds the bases after hitting a home run off New York Mets pitcher Matt Harvey during the eighth inning of Game 1 of the National League baseball championship series Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Julie Jacobson) Julie Jacobson Lester gives up big HRs, Cubs fall to Mets in NLCS opener 
Chicago Cubs' Kyle Schwarber makes a sliding catch on a ball hit by New York Mets' David Wright during the first inning of Game 1 of the National League baseball championship series Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Julie Jacobson) Posted: Sunday, October 18, 2015 12:27 am | Updated: 1:30 am, Sun Oct 18, 2015. 
NEW YORK (AP) — The Chicago Cubs envisioned Jon Lester on the mound starting big October games. 
They did not imagine him giving up big October home runs. Subscription Required An online service is needed to view this article in its entirety.
